intro: Sutera brachiata, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for. Sutera brachiata prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
